TcStandardType.description: The BOMEdit object is a record of a change made to a BOMLine object. The BOMEdit object consolidates every aspect of the change in a single object when the changes are saved. The BOMEdit object includes a reference to the BOMView Revision object, any quantity or occurrence changes, and a reference to a BOMSupersedure object, if applicable. The BOMEdit object is used in the Teamcenter Structure Manager and Change Manager functional areas.

TcProperty.description: Obsolete - The property CMObjectString is a runtime string. The inherited property object_string should be used instead.

The runtime property CMBomEditQty is a double which represents a change in quantity to the BOMLine object associated with this BOMEdit object. This quantity is the new quantity being applied as a result of the BOM edit.

The runtime property CMObjectName is a string which represents a user-defined name for the BOMEdit object. The value of this property is used in forming the name of an associated BOMSupersedure object in cases where the BOM edit is the first add or cancel of a supersedure.
The runtime property CMQuantityDiff is a double which represents the calculated difference between the original quantity and the new quantity provided by this BOM edit.
The runtime property CMBOMSupersedure is an untyped reference to a BOMSupersedure object in which this BOMEdit object is used.

The runtime property CMProblemBvr is an untyped reference to a BOMView Revision object used as the problem item on an associated change object when Change Management is used to manage the changes to the BOMView Revision object.
The runtime property CMObjectType is a string which represents the display name of the type of the BOMView Revision object modified as a result of this BOMEdit object.
Obsolete - Property CMObjectFullName is obsolete, use property CMObjectName or object_string instead.

TcStandardType.description: The BOMSupersedure object is record of changes to a BOM structure that includes a mapping of elements removed or added to that structure. The BOMSupersedure object provides Structure Manager with the capability of managing and displaying complex changes made to BOM structures. The BOMSupersedure includes a list of added elements, a list of removed (cancelled) elements, and a reference to the original top-level BOMView Revision object for the BOM structure. The BOMSupersedure object is used in the Teamcenter Structure Manager and Teamcenter Change Manager functional areas.

TcProperty.description: Deprecation candidate - the runtime property CMAdds is a runtime version of this object's CMBOMAddList property, so we should just use the CMBOMAddList property directly.
Deprecation candidate - the runtime property CMCancels is runtime version of this object's CMBOMCancelList property, so we should just use the CMBOMCancelList property directly.

The runtime property CMCustomFormTag is an untyped reference to a Form object which represents a custom form attached to the supersedure. Property CMCustomFormTag provides an extension point for users to add forms to capture additional properties to be tracked with their supersedures.

The runtime property CMChangeRevTag is an untyped reference to a ChangeItemRevision object associated with this supersedure. Property CMChangeRevTag is applicable when Change Management is used to manage the changes to the BOM structure with supersedures and allows a genealogy of the changes to be kept.
Obsolete - Property CMObjectFullName is obsolete, use property CMObjectName or object_string instead.

The runtime property CMObjectName is a string which represents a displayable name for the supersedure. The value of this property is constructed from the CMObjectName property values of the first add BOMEdit object and the first cancel BOMEdit object of the CMAdds and CMCancels lists.
Obsolete - The property CMObjectString is a runtime string. The inherited property object_string should be used instead.
The runtime property CMObjectType is a string which represents the display name of the type of the top-level BOMView Revision modified by this supersedure.

The runtime property CMProblemBvr is an untyped reference to a BOMView Revision used as the problem item on an associated change object when Change Management is used to manage the changes to the BOMView Revision object.

TcStandardType.description: ChangeItemRevision object is an abstract subclass of ItemRevision for change items to be used in change management to manage objects associated with a change management business process. ChangeItemRevision object is the highest level change item revision in the class hierarchy of which all other change items revision are subclasses. The ChangeItemRevision business object adds key properties for state vectors, dynamic participants, comments, and problem/impacted/solution/reference/workbreakdown/implements relations. ChangeItemRevision object is used in the Teamcenter Change Management functional area.

TcProperty.description: Property CMHasImpactedItem is an array of CMHasImpactedItem relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a change managed object that will be revised for a solution.

Property CMHasProblemItem is an array of CMHasProblemItem relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a change managed object that is the perceived cause of an issue or problem for the associated change object.

Property CMHasSolutionItem is an array of CMHasSolutionItem relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a change managed object that was developed as a solution for the associated change object.

Property CMHasWorkBreakdown is an array of CMHasWorkBreakdown relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a Schedule object that may be used as an implementation plan for the associated change object.

Property CMReferences is an array of CMReferences relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is merely a reference for the associated change object and not considered change managed.

Property CMImplements is an array of CMImplements relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a change object of lesser maturity. The CMImplements relation ChangeItemRevision primary object is a more mature change object than the ChangeItemRevision secondary object that it's implementing. For example, a GnChangeNoticeRevision will be primary object and implement a GnChangeRequestRevision secondary object or a GnChangeRequestRevision will be a primary object and implement a GnProblemReportRevision secondary object.

Deprecation candidate - a newer more versatile compound property cm0Analyst was added in Teamcenter 10.1.2 and the property Analyst will be deprecated in the near future. Property Analyst is a runtime reference to an Analyst participant object which represents the analyst staffing position assignment for this change object. Property Analyst staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for single assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The analyst staffing position typically has key technical lead responsibilities with the associated change object.

Property ChangeImplementationBoard is a runtime array of references to ChangeImplementationBoard participant objects which represents the change implementation board staffing position assignments for this change object. Property ChangeImplementationBoard staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for multi-assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The change implementation board staffing position typically has review and approval of implementation plan responsibilities with the associated change object.

Property ChangeReviewBoard is a runtime array of references to ChangeReviewBoard participant objects which represents the change review board staffing position assignments for this change object. Property ChangeReviewBoard staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for multi-assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The change review board staffing position typically has review and approval of solution plan responsibilities with the associated change object.

Deprecation candidate - a newer more versatile compound property cm0ChangeSpecialist1 was added in Teamcenter 10.1.2 and the property ChangeSpecialist1 will be deprecated in the near future. Property ChangeSpecialist1 is a runtime reference to a ChangeSpecialist1 participant object which represents the change specialist 1 staffing position assignment for this change object. Property ChangeSpecialist1 staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for single assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The change specialist 1 staffing position typically has key administrative management responsibilities with the associated change object. There are ChangeSpecialist1, ChangeSpecialist2 and ChangeSpecialist3 objects, but by default it is only ChangeSpecialist1 we use in Teamcenter Change Management. The other two are there to comply with CMII industry standard and can be exposed and used by customers if they wish.

Property ChangeSpecialist2 is a runtime reference to a ChangeSpecialist2 participant object which represents the change specialist 2 staffing position assignment for this change object. Property ChangeSpecialist2 staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for single assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The change specialist 2 staffing position typically has key administrative management responsibilities with the associated change object. There are ChangeSpecialist1, ChangeSpecialist2 and ChangeSpecialist3 objects, but by default it is only ChangeSpecialist1 we use in Teamcenter Change Management. The other two are there to comply with CMII industry standard and can be exposed and used by customers if they wish.

Property ChangeSpecialist3 is a runtime reference to a ChangeSpecialist3 participant object which represents the change specialist 3 staffing position assignment for this change object. Property ChangeSpecialist3 staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for single assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The change specialist 3 staffing position typically has key administrative management responsibilities with the associated change object. There are ChangeSpecialist1, ChangeSpecialist2 and ChangeSpecialist3 objects, but by default it is only ChangeSpecialist1 we use in Teamcenter Change Management. The other two are there to comply with CMII industry standard and can be exposed and used by customers if they wish.

Deprecation candidate - a newer more versatile compound property cm0Requestor was added in Teamcenter 10.1.2 and the property Requestor will be deprecated in the near future. Property Requestor is a runtime reference to a Requestor participant object which represents the requestor staffing position assignment for this change object. Property Requestor staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for single assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The requestor staffing position typically has the requirements owner responsibilities with the associated change object. The Requestor object by default is initially set to the creator/owner of the associated change object.

Property Cm0Incorporates is an array of Cm0Incorporates relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a WorkspaceObject object. The Cm0Incorporates relation identifies the partially incorporated objects that are being incorporated by the ChangeItemRevision primary object.

Property Cm0PreviousEffectivity is an array of Cm0PreviousEffectivity relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is an Effectivity object. The Cm0PreviousEffectivity relation is used to associate a previous Effectivity object used to configure the child revisions of an ItemRevision that is related via a CMHasImpacted relation to a ChangeItemRevision object.

Property cm0DerivableTypes is a runtime array of strings which represents a list of types and their display names that can be derived from this object. Each string in the array starts with the type name followed by a forward slash and ends with the display name for that type. Property cm0DerivableTypes is used to display a list of the change types that can be selected from the change derive operation based on the context change object and the user's privileges.

Property Cm0HasProposal is an array of Cm0HasProposal relation objects where this change object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is a Fnd0MarkupSpace (proposal) object. The Cm0HasProposal relation is used to identify the proposals that contribute solution ideas to a ChangeItemRevision object.
This is a relation from Change Item revision to Working Environment
Property cm0IsProblemsModifiable is a runtime boolean which represents whether current user can add/remove the CMHasProblemItem relations to this ProblemReportRevision object. NULL value allowed.
Property cm0IsReferencesModifiable is a runtime boolean which represents whether current user can add/remove the CMReferences relations to this ProblemReportRevision object. NULL value allowed.

cm0RelationsToPropagate is String Array which represents list of relations which needs to be auto propagated to new change object when auto propagation is turned ON. cm0RelationsToPropagate provides list of relations which enable derive functionality to auto propagate relations to new change object.

cm0AutoPropagateRelations is Boolean which indicate whether to automates the propagation of relations from source to derived objects for a derive change operation. cm0AutoPropagateRelations provides true or false by reading preference CM_automate_derive_propagation.

Property cm0ChangeContributors is a runtime array of references to Assignee ( Group Member or Resource Pool ) of Cm0ChangeContributors participants objects which represents the change contributor staffing position assignments for this change object. Property cm0ChangeContributors staffing assignment is used for assignment responsibilities for multi-assignee tasks in workflows and responsibilities in change management. The cm0ChangeContributors staffing position typically has key technical responsibilities, generating and adding solutions to the associated change object.

TcStandardType.description: ChangeNoticeRevision object is a subclass of GnChangeNoticeRevision for change items to be used in change management to manage objects associated with a change management business process. ChangeNoticeRevision object is the type of change object used to manage the implementation of ChangeRequestRevision object(s), plan implementation, review and approve implementation plan, execute implementation plan and develop solutions, set effectivity and release the change object and its solutions. The ChangeNoticeRevision business object adds key properties for priority, customer approval and special instructions. ChangeNoticeRevision object is used in the Teamcenter Change Management functional area.

TcProperty.description: Property CMImpactedItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent the change managed objects that will be revised to generate solutions to address this ChangeNoticeRevision object. These impacted objects are associated with this ChangeNoticeRevision object via the CMHasImpactedItem relation objects where this ChangeNoticeRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the impacted object.

Property CMImplement is a runtime array of ChangeItemRevision objects which represent the change objects of a lesser maturity that are implemented by this change object of a greater maturity. These implemented change objects are associated with this ChangeNoticeRevision object via the CMImplements relation objects where this ChangeNoticeRevision object is the more mature primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the lesser mature change object. For example, a ChangeNoticeRevision may be a primary object and implement a ChangeRequestRevision secondary object.

Property CMProblemItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent the perceived cause of an issue or problem for this ChangeNoticeRevision object. These problem objects are associated with this ChangeNoticeRevision object via the CMHasProblemItem relation objects where this ChangeNoticeRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the problem object.

Property CMReferenceItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent mere references for the associated ChangeNoticeRevision object and is not considered change managed. These reference objects are associated with this ChangeNoticeRevision object via the CMReferences relation objects where this ChangeNoticeRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the reference object.

Property CMSolutionItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent the change managed objects that were developed as a solution for this ChangeNoticeRevision object. These solution objects are associated with this ChangeNoticeRevision object via the CMHasSolutionItem relation objects where this ChangeNoticeRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the solution object.

Property CMWorkBreakdown is a runtime array of Schedule objects which represent implementation plans for the associated ChangeNoticeRevision object. These Schedule objects are associated with this ChangeNoticeRevision object via the CMHasWorkBreakdown relation objects where this ChangeNoticeRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the Schedule object.
This is a runtime Boolean result of the evaluation of the BMIDE condition for the primary criteria for adding Solution relations to a change object.
This is a runtime Boolean result of the evaluation of the BMIDE condition for the primary criteria for adding Impacted relations to a change object.

TcStandardType.description: ChangeRequestRevision object is a subclass of GnChangeRequestRevision for change items to be used in change management to manage objects associated with a change management business process. ChangeRequestRevision object is the type of change object used to manage the implementation of ProblemReportRevision object(s), perform impact analysis, propose technical solutions, estimate the cost and authorize the implementation phase of the change. The ChangeRequestRevision business object adds properties for warranty impact, priority, costs, technical recommendation and solution proposal. ChangeRequestRevision object is used in the Teamcenter Change Management functional area.

TcProperty.description: Property CMImpactedItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent the change managed objects that will be revised to generate solutions to address this ChangeRequestRevision object. These impacted objects are associated with this ChangeRequestRevision object via the CMHasImpactedItem relation objects where this ChangeRequestRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the impacted object.

Property CMImplement is a runtime array of ChangeItemRevision objects which represent the change objects of a lesser maturity that are implemented by this change object of a greater maturity. These implemented change objects are associated with this ChangeRequestRevision object via the CMImplements relation objects where this ChangeRequestRevision object is the more mature primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the lesser mature change object. For example, a ChangeRequestRevision may be a primary object and implement a ProblemReportRevision secondary object.

Property CMProblemItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent the perceived cause of an issue or problem for this ChangeRequestRevision object. These problem objects are associated with this ChangeRequestRevision object via the CMHasProblemItem relation objects where this ChangeRequestRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the problem object.

Property CMReferenceItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent mere references for the associated ChangeRequestRevision object and is not considered change managed. These reference objects are associated with this ChangeRequestRevision object via the CMReferences relation objects where this ChangeRequestRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the reference object.

Property CMWorkBreakdown is a runtime array of Schedule objects which represent implementation plans for the associated ChangeRequestRevision object. These Schedule objects are associated with this ChangeRequestRevision object via the CMHasWorkBreakdown relation objects where this ChangeRequestRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the Schedule object.
This is a runtime Boolean result of the evaluation of the BMIDE condition for the primary criteria for adding Impacted relations to a change object.

TcStandardType.description: ProblemReportRevision object is a subclass of GnProblemReportRevision for change items to be used in change management to manage objects associated with a change management business process. ProblemReportRevision object is the type of change object used to manage the documentation of an issue, reproduction of an issue, determine issue severity and priority, and disposition the issue. The ProblemReportRevision business object adds key properties for priority, severity, environment, verification, ramifications, and sequence of events. ProblemReportRevision object is used in the Teamcenter Change Management functional area.

TcProperty.description: Property CMProblemItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent the perceived cause of an issue or problem for this ProblemItemRevision object. These problem objects are associated with this ProblemItemRevision object via the CMHasProblemItem relation objects where this ProblemItemRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the problem object.

Property CMReferenceItems is a runtime array of WorkspaceObject objects which represent mere references for the associated ProblemItemRevision object and is not considered change managed. These reference objects are associated with this ProblemItemRevision object via the CMReferences relation objects where this ProblemItemRevision object is the primary referenced object and where the secondary referenced object is the reference object.

PropertyOperation.description: Getter for a Tag Array Property
PropertyOperation.name: getCm0ChangeContributors

TcProperty.description: The runtime property cm0ChangeItemRev is an untyped reference to a ChangeNoticeRevision representing the change object used to track changes to revision effectivity made to items in this BOMWindow object.

The runtime property cm0ChangeItemRevStatus is an untyped reference to a ReleaseStatus object. This release status object is the preferred release status for changes made to items in this BOMWindow object.

The runtime property cm0ChangeNoticeRevShareMode is a string which represents the mode selected for the creation of statuses on item revisions when the changes are tracked using a ChangeNoticeRevision object. Allowed values are "None" (item revisions get no status), "Share" (item revisions share the preferred status with the ChangeNoticeRevision object), "Clone" (item revisions get new release statuses and effectivities that are clones of the preferred release status), and "ShareEffectivityOnly" (each item revision gets a new release status and shares the effectivity with the ChangeNoticeRevision object's preferred release status).
Runtime property to hold ECN context in which the WorkspaceObject got created.

TcExtension.description: PostAction extension on WorkspaceObject::IMANTYPE_init_intl_props to register bulk loader for runtime properties.
TcExtension.name: Cm0WSO_init_intl_props_postaction

ServiceInterface.description:
The ChangeManagement service provides a variety of operations to satisfy primarily the specific needs of the Change Manager GUI. There are operations to support the Change Home functionality for finding and creating Change Home folders. There are also a multitude of operations to support the BOM Change, Supersedure, and Genealogy functionalities. It is important to note that many of these operations, when used directly, can be challenging as they are dealing with objects and data in a more primitive way. For client (UI) developers, it is more advisable to use the helper methods available in the client plugins.The ChangeManagement service can be used for supporting following use cases:
    • Retreiving a list of all Change Home folders for the user
    • Adding and Removing change home folder(s)
    • Finding all BOMEdit objects for a given change revision
    • Creating a BOM Change within the Structure Manager
    • Creating supersedures
    • Updating supersedures
    • Finding supersedures
    • Deleting supersedures
    • Getting the details for a note change
    • Getting the necessary details for a variety of BOM Change/supersedure related contexts
ServiceInterface.name: ChangeManagement

Struct.description: <font face="courier" height="10">ConfigureChangeSearchData</font> structure represents all the details of a Change Home folder.

StructElement.description:
A unique client identifier. This is a unique string supplied by the caller. This ID
is used to identify return data elements and partial errors associated with this input structure.

StructElement.description:
This parameter represents a reference to the solution item BOM View Revision
(BVR) and is a required parameter. A solution item is a new component that replaces an old component in the parent assembly. Solution items are supplementary components that are involved in the solution the change is bringing about and the affected item represents the final assembly product containing the solution items.
StructElement.name: solutionBvr

StructElement.description:
This required parameter determines if the Supercedure created is a transfer type
Supercedure and takes in a boolean true or false value. Transfer Supercedures are generated when a component is moved from one assembly to another.
StructElement.name: isTransferred

StructElement.description:
A list of BOM Adds which represents the additions made to the assembly. It is a
required input element.
StructElement.name: bomAdds

StructElement.description:
A list of BOM Cancels which denotes the deletions made from the assembly and
is a required input parameter.
StructElement.name: bomCancels

StructElement.description: A placeholder for additional attributes and this is an optional parameter. i.e it can be empty.
StructElement.name: extendedAttributes

Struct.description: ConnectChangeNoticeToContextInElem structure contains the details of a single element necessary for associating a changeObject ( currently, must be ChangeNoticeRevision) with the optional container ( currently, must be BOMWindow).
Struct.name: ConnectChangeNoticeToContextInElem

StructElement.description: The ChangeNoticeRevision which is to be used to associate with the context. Currently, only BOMWindow object is supported for context.
StructElement.name: changeObject

StructElement.description: A context to which the changeNoticeRevision is to be associated. Currently, if specified must be BOMWindow object.
StructElement.name: context

StructElement.description:
The mode to be used for determining how the revisions in the solution folder of the ChangeNoticeRevision are to be released. If this optional argument is not empty, it must be one of "Share", "None", "Clone", "ShareEffectivityOnly".
    • Share: share the release status on revisions with the "preferred" release status On ChangeNoticeRevision that is a subset of the values given by preference "MEMCN_release_statues".
    • None: no release status on revisions.
    • Clone: new release statuses on revisions cloned from "preferred" release status.
    • ShareEffectivityOnly: new release statues on revisions with same type as the "preferred" release status on ChangeNoticeRevision, but with shared effectivity. If specified, will set the "cm0ChangeNoticeRevShareMode" runtime property on the BOMWindow.
StructElement.name: shareMode

StructElement.description: Currently, not used.
StructElement.name: info
